περικάθ-ημαι,
Ionic dialect περι-κάτημαι, Ionic dialect 3rd.pers. plural imperfect περιεκατέατο or περικατέατο [Refs 5th c.BC+]:—to be seated all round, τραπέζῃ at table, [Refs] codices: mostly c.accusative, invest, besiege a town, τὴν Νίνον [LXX]; also περιεκάθητο ἐπὶ Ταβαθών[LXX]; of ships, blockade, [Refs 5th c.BC+]: c.accusative person, sit down by one as a companion, [Refs]
